Description: Painted wooden stooping female figure; arms and feet lost; attachment-holes at the sides; part of a model group. The associated jar is BM47555-454 according to Zitman (2010, 235 (II)).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Zitman, M. 2010. The necropolis of Assiut : a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (OLA 180), II. Leuven, 235.
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (II, 235)
